articles.title: Third person arrested in Argentina over attempt to assassinate vice-president
articles.description: Agustina Díaz was arrested reportedly after a forensic examination of Brenda Uliarte’s phone revealed messages regarding the attack
articles.content:
A third suspect has been arrested over the attempted assassination of Argentina’s vice-president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, as investigators pursue suspicions that the attack was not the act of a lone gunman.
Fernández was unharmed during the i... [2377 chars]

articles.title: Fan Shot Dead in Clash Before Football Match in Argentina
articles.description: A 36-year-old man was shot dead in Argentina during clashes between rival supporters of the same club, Club Atletico de San Martin, before a second-division top-of-the-table encounter against Belgrano
articles.content:
A 36-year-old man was shot dead in Argentina during clashes between rival supporters of the same club before a second-division match, police said.
Witnesses said the clash was among supporters of Club Atletico de San Martin in the northwestern city o... [639 chars]

articles.title: Argentina inflation, heading towards 100%, seen easing back from July peak
articles.description: By Hernan NessiBUENOS AIRES, Sept 13 (Reuters) - Argentina's inflation rate, heading towards 100% this year, likely eased in August versus a 20-year peak the month before, analysts polled by Reuters said, bringing some hope sharp price rises could start to be tempered.A survey of 21 analysts gave a median forecast of a still very high 6.6% rise for the month, lower than the

articles.description: MADRID (AP) — The Ymer brothers keep coming through for Sweden in the Davis Cup Finals.

articles.title: World tango dancers flock to spiritual home Buenos Aires
articles.description: Over 500 tango dancers from Argentina and the world are congregating in Buenos Aires for a major festival of the dance in its spiritual home, with concerts, classes and a competition to compete for the international tango crown.

articles.title: Rugby-Hooker Marx wants Boks to match Argentina’s passion
articles.description: The Boks trail table-toppers New Zealand by two points and will likely have to win both home and away in their final two games against Argentina to stand a chance of taking the title. But they have blown hot and cold this season and battled for consistency as they come off a strong performance in the 24-8 win over Australia in Sydney last time out.
articles.content: South Africa hooker Malcolm Marx says the Springboks will have to match Argentina's intensity in their must-win Rugby Championship fixture in Buenos Aires on Saturday. The Boks trail table-toppers New Zealand by two points and will likely have to win... [1771 chars]
